instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00426 not running on charger
threads.message:
I'm working on a 820-00426-A wich is running on a charged battery.
It is not running/charging with the original charger (85W).
On my laboratory power supply with 19V it's charging and running.

When i plug in the charger the first time, green light is flashing one time - then nothing (no green, no orange)
PPDCIN_G3H goes up to 12.4V and is then falling down to 2V (naked board, original charger 85W)
There is Data-Communication on SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and  SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA

Can you give me help for further troubleshooting?

threads.title: 820-00426 not running on charger
threads.message:
Looks like input leakage.
Original charger is smart enough to detect it and get blocked.

Q7180 and D7010 are the first suspects; sometime may be R7012.
Post Q7010 voltages, with the lab PSU connected.

threads.title: 820-00426 not running on charger
threads.message:
Q7010 measurements:
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL = 18.45V
DCIN_ISOL_GATE_R = 6.75V
PPDCIN_G3H = 18.45V

D7010 Diodemode = 0.76V
R7012 = 22.1k

threads.title: 820-00426 not running on charger
threads.message:
Changing Q7180 did help.
Thank you so much ;-)
